page.title: 14MERSEA 80 YEARS AGO.
page.content: I talked to Mrs King who used to live in the Mill in Mill Road,which was demolished after being hit by a bomb during the second world war.I asked Mrs King what had changed the most on Mersea Island.She said,"The thing that has changed the most on Mersea is the number of people." Behind the Mill was a slaughter house,the bones are still there.Mrs King said, "It was very good fun living in the Mill".Some of the shops which were around 80 years ago are still there. "The biggest change, though, is the difference in the number of people living on the island," she said."There are so many more people now than there used to be."
